Class Rally

java.lang.Object
  Rally

public class Rally
extends Object

The Rally class stores information about a rally

Version:
04/03/2013
Author:
S.D.Wheeler

Constructor Summary
Rally(String id, String ven, int days, int fc, int maxp)
          Creates a Rally with a unique id, venue, fee code, no of days and the max number of people allowed from parameter values, and sets start date to 1/1/13.

Constructor Detail

Rally

public Rally(String id,
             String ven,
             int days,
             int fc,
             int maxp)
Creates a Rally with a unique id, venue, fee code, no of days and the max number of people allowed from parameter values, and sets start date to 1/1/13.

Parameters:
id - it is the responsibility of the client to ensure that id is a unique number.
ven - is the String representation of the venue.
days - is the number of days rally is running.
fc - is the fee code for the rally.
maxp - is the maximum number of people allowed to enter the rally.
Method Detail

book

public void book(Rider ride)
allows the rider to be booked onto the rally. also adds the correct full fee dependent on rider type, to the rally total.

Parameters:
ride - this selects the rider to be added to the rally.

changeFee

public void changeFee(int fCode,
                      double price)
allows the fee codes to be changed.

Parameters:
fCode - this selects the element from the array that needs updating.
price - this is the price value, the element in the array needs updating too.

getAsString

public String getAsString()
returns the full details of the Rally including all riders and amount taken as a String.

Returns:
value returned is all the full details in regards to the Rally including all riders and amount taken as a String.

returns the details of the Rally as a String.

Returns:
value returned is all the details in regards to the Rally as a String.

getStartDate

public String getStartDate()
returns date from GregorianCalendar class as set of 3 ints d/m/yyyy.

Returns:
value returned is startDate as a Gregorian Calendar date.

public String getVenue()
returns the Venue as a String.

Returns:
value returned is venue as a String.

hasBooked

public boolean hasBooked(Rider ride)
returns if a rider is on the Rally as a boolean.

Parameters:
ride - this selects the rider to be checked for in the rally.
Returns:
value returned is whether the rider is on the Rally as a boolean.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
returns whether the Rally is full as a boolean.

Returns:
value returned is whether the Rally is full as a boolean.

leave

public void leave(Rider ride)
allows the rider to leave the rally.

Parameters:
ride - this selects the rider to be removed from the rally.

setStartDate

public void setStartDate(int date,
                         int month,
                         int year)
allows date to be set using the GregorianCalendar class.

Parameters:
date - this stores the day into the GregorianCalendar fields array[5].
month - this stores the month into the GregorianCalendar fields array[2].
year - this stores the year into the GregorianCalendar fields array[1].
